description.plain:
Bill Kahan Kapri (born Dieuson Octave on June 11th, 1997), better known as Kodak Black, is a rapper from Pompano Beach, Florida. A rapper since the age of 12, Kodak first began to rise in popularity after Drake posted an Instagram video dancing along to Kodak’s song “SKRT.” He’s also responsible for hits such as “Tunnel Vision,” which chronicles his journey in and out of imprisonment, and his XXXTENTACION-assisted “Roll in Peace.”

Kodak Black has been arrested multiple times for a variety of offenses including possession of a deadly weapon by a convicted felon, fleeing from officers, false imprisonment, and armed robbery. Black served jail time for several misdemeanor drug charges in his native Florida, as well as in South Carolina for sexual assault.  Most recently, Kodak was booked into prison on the night of Thursday, January 18, 2019. Authorities claim their arrest stemmed from an Instagram post of Kodak waving a gun around recklessly in front of a child while smoking marijuana.

songs.title: Tunnel Vision

description.plain:
In ‘'Tunnel Vision,’‘ Kodak raps about serving jail time, the corrupt prison system, and other issues he’s faced in the past. Metro Boomin and Southside provide the beat.

Before the song’s release, Kodak teased the track via live performances, on his Instagram, and in several videos that received more than 1 million views before the song officially dropped.

The “Tunnel Vision” music video shows Kodak standing in front of a burning cross—a reference to the KKK. The video also features a white man wearing a hat that says “Make America Hate Again", a nod to President Donald Trump’s campaign slogan, “Make America Great Again.” The man in the hat prepares to shoot a black man, but his gun fails, and the two come to blows. Finally, a little girl appears and shouts “Stop!” which brings the video to an end.

songs.title: No Flockin’

description.plain:
“No Flockin” finds Kodak Black bragging about the almighty dollar. No matter who, where, when or what, he’ll always have money on his mind.

This song was Kodak’s break-out hit. After receiving a buzz for his previous songs, “SKRT” and “Skrilla,” this was the one that led him to be known nation-wide.

The song was also featured in Episode 2 of Drake’s OVO Sound Radio. Before that, Drake was captured on video dancing to Kodak’s “SKRT,” blowing up his spot. However, in an interview with XXL, Kodak said that he didn’t care too much about the 6 God’s co-sign:

I heard about, but I didn’t know what that did. I just knew that was Drake, so… You trying to show you fuck with me or what? We ain’t never talked on the phone, like he was texting me and shit. I’m direct with it. So, if you’re trying to show me that you fuck with me, call me. Throw me on your album so I can get me some royalties.

songs.full_title: ZEZE by Kodak Black (Ft. Offset & Travis Scott)
songs.title: ZEZE

description.plain:
Kodak Black enlists Offset and Travis Scott for “ZEZE,” a song on which the trio discusses their decadent lifestyles on the song. Produced by Chicago-native d.a. got that dope, this track heavily features steel drum instrumentation.

Following “If I’m Lyin, I’m Flyin” two weeks prior, this is Kodak’s second single since being released from jail in August 2018 and the second single from Dying to Live.

In early September 2018, Kodak posted a now-deleted short clip of him and Travis Scott dancing to the song’s instrumental in the studio. This video became a viral sensation known as the #WaitingChallenge that inspired numerous memes. Kodak later posted another video of just himself dancing to the instrumental.

Kodak performed during the Florida A&M University homecoming festivities on October 5, 2018, and announced the song’s name and release date. One day before the song’s release, Kodak posted the cover art, which revealed that Offset was on the song, which was previously unknown. The song was released as expected on October 12, 2018.

The official music video was released on November 23, 2018. Travis Scott directed the video by himself. The video depicts the three rappers having a problem with the original film director, and hence things are the way they are. It is basically a behind-the-scenes twisted video, showing the three under a green screen and editing their effects.

One day before the song’s release, Kodak posted the cover art, which revealed that Offset was on the song, which was previously unknown. The song was released as expected on October 12, 2018.

The official music video was released on November 23, 2018. Travis Scott directed the video by himself. The video depicts the three rappers having a problem with the original film director, and hence things are the way they are. It is basically a behind-the-scenes twisted video, showing the three under a green screen and editing their effects.

songs.title: SKRT

description.plain:
“SKRT” is the sound that Kodak Black’s tires make when driving away from a sticky situation.

The song was released in 2014, but the track only started gaining momentum in late 2015, after receiving Drake’s highly coveted cosign—on the sixth episode of OVO Sound Radio and on his Instagram account.

https://instagram.com/p/9NIha_jQGu/?taken-by=champagnepapi

Despite the impact Drizzy had on introducing “SKRT” to the masses, Kodak told The Fader that he’s greater than the cosign: “Drake ain’t make me.”

The New Yorker wrote that “SKRT” is “a primal declaration of forward momentum.”

With this hook, Octave joins other young rappers who have rejected an old-school emphasis on lyrical variety, individualism, and personal catharsis. (Remember how he feels about school?) These are the devices that helped turn Kanye West and Eminem into stars; Octave and peers like Silentó and Desiigner have been castigated by some

songs.full_title: Codeine Dreaming by Kodak Black (Ft. Lil Wayne)
songs.title: Codeine Dreaming

description.plain:
“Codeine Dreaming” marks the first collaboration between Kodak Black and Lil Wayne. It first appeared on the deluxe version of Kodak’s 2017 mixtape Project Baby 2 and then on his 2018 mixtape Heart Break Kodak.

The collaboration was a surprise to fans and media since Kodak and Wayne had previously taken shots at each other. In an interview with the New York Times in October 2016, Wayne claimed he didn’t know who Kodak Black even was. Kodak responded by re-tweeting a fans suggestion that he is this generation’s Lil Wayne and challenging Wayne to a boxing match.

The track itself plays around with dreaming and space metaphors. Both refer to highs caused by using codeine and other drugs. Wayne and Kodak also use the latter to wax lyrical about being far beyond their competition. The production also resembles the noises made by a spaceship, creating an ‘out of this world’ atmosphere.

songs.title: Transportin’

description.plain:
Released in 18 August 2017 along with Kodaks album “Project Baby 2”, “Transportin' ” is a song where Kodak shows off his luxurious and unique lifestyle, boasting about his high amount of money, drugs, guns and his fast transportation/supercars.

Even though he mentions lyrics like “Ridin' sporty, actin' sporty, I can’t control it” and “Bought it ‘cause I wanted it” he mixes the criminal theme about his life into this song as well creating a classic yet typical trap song.

The music video to “Transportin' ” is very flashy and conceited as he dances whilst showing off expensive things from multiple vehicles in the specific colour orange to his high amount of cash.

Notably, everything in the music video is a dark cyan colour or orange. By doing this Kodak represents his home state Florida. The football team “Florida Gators” is seen on his clothing and furniture and everything is themed to represent his love for Florida and the football team.

https://youtu.be/Ns167_llTiA

songs.full_title: Calling My Spirit by Kodak Black
songs.title: Calling My Spirit

description.plain:
“Calling My Spirit” is a song by Florida artist Kodak Black from his 2018 album Dying to Live.
This song was produced by Southside and Jake-One.

On this emotional track, Kodak talks about he has put his spirit in every song by him. He also talks about how the whole rap industry needs to sell their soul for actual attention and fame.

songs.title: I.M.Y (I Miss You)

description.plain: The 18-year-old lyricist was pulled over by police who then found weed on him, and discovered that he was driving with a suspended license. It was also reported that Kodak Black had a warrant out for robbery and kidnapping. In the first verse Kodak is talking to his girl and apologizing for leaving her and having to go to jail. In the second verse Kodak is talking from jail, rapping about how much he misses his girl.

songs.full_title: Pimpin Ain't Eazy by Kodak Black
songs.title: Pimpin Ain’t Eazy

description.plain:
One month before the start of his Dying to Live Tour, Kodak Black keep his fans waiting with a brand new single, “Pimpin' Ain’t Eazy.” The song comes with an accompanying music video.

“Pimpin' Ain’t Eazy” is a classic sentence, as rappers regularly mention it in their lyrics, and is most likely a reference to Big Daddy Kane’s eponymous single; even though the first to ever use it in a song is Ice-T.

This song can be considered as a perfect illustration of egotrip: Kodak is continuously boasting about his success, what seems to pose a move away from Kodak’s introspection through the emotional and more mature rap of his last album Dying to Live.

songs.title: Malcolm X.X.X.

description.plain:
“Malcolm X.X.X.” is a tribute to XXXTENTACION, a friend and fellow rapper of Kodak Black who died in June 2018. They were both incarcerated in Broward County Jail in March 2017 and collaborated later that year on Kodak’s “Roll in Peace.”

This song samples Malcolm X, who was an avid African-American civil and human rights advocate during the 1960s. Kodak compares XXXTENTACION to Malcolm X, amalgamating their names. Both figures were killed by gun violence.

songs.title: Snot Thot

description.plain: Kodak is making this song to indicate that he doesn’t care about a woman’s history. He’s cool with anything as long as he feels a connection with her, no matter how many people she has sex with or what she does. Kodak is following in the footsteps of 21 Savage, who he rapped with during the 2016 XXL cypher, by dating a proudly known “hoe”.

description.plain:
Originally a track called ‘Can I’ by Drake and Beyoncé, it was left on the cutting block after it was leaked.

The track name 201519971800 are all significant numbers to Kodak. 2015 is the year his son was born, 1997 is the year he was born and 1800 is the number of his block where he grew up.

description.plain:
Announced hours before its release on Instagram, “If I’m Lyin, I’m Flyin” is Kodak’s first single as primary artist since his release from prison in August 2018.

He appeared on “Wake Up in the Sky” with Gucci Mane and Bruno Mars two weeks earlier.

songs.title: Conscience

description.plain:
“Conscience”, by Kodak Black, features rap superstar Future exchanging verses with Kodak.

The theme of this song is the struggle between right and wrong. Kodak is expressing how the street life has stripped him of his conscience. He describes a pattern of consistency indulging in vices.

songs.full_title: First Day Out by Kodak Black
songs.title: First Day Out

description.plain:
Much like Gucci Mane and Tee Grizzley before him, Kodak Black made a song his “First Day Out” of jail.

Kodak released from jail on June 5, 2017, only 33 days after being sentenced on May 4, 2017 following his violation of house arrest.

Kodak raps about his probation which will continue for 5 years after his release, as well as his house arrest continuing for another year.

description.plain: After a leaked version of this song was released late 2016, the final version produced by DJ Swift and Dubba-AA was released. The song mostly speaks about growing up the slums and being influenced by the streets which they referred to as “water” in this song. NBA YoungBoy grew up in Baton Rouge, Louisiana while Kodak Black in Broward County, Florida.

songs.title: Halloween

description.plain:
“Halloween” was dropped by Kodak Black as a single the day before Halloween on October 30th, 2017.

On “Halloween” Kodak raps about his sinister and evil actions, and how because of that he should have been born on Halloween. There are numerous Halloween references throughout, and he relates them to his own upbringing.

songs.title: Expeditiously

description.plain:
“Expeditiously is the next installment in the ongoing beef between Kodak Black and T.I.

The song title refers to when T.I demanded that Kodak “expeditiously” apologize for disrespecting Lauren London and the late great Nipsey Hussle.

Kodak made this song seemingly in response to T.I., The Game, Gillie The Kid and the media trying to “cancel” him.

songs.full_title: Day for Day by Kodak Black
songs.title: Day for Day

description.plain: This is the first song of Kodak Black’s highly anticipated album ‘Painting Pictures’ which dropped March 31, 2017. At the beginning of the song, news reporters are explaining why Kodak was in jail when he was and why he got sent back. In this song, he implies that he dedicates his work for the people he knows that are still in jail. He lives ‘Day to Day’ for everyone that is back in the penitentiary. He also could be calling out the United State’s Law Enforcement. He says ‘I was already sentenced, before I came up out the womb’. He could be stating that since he is an African American that he didn’t even have to do anything illegal to be put in jail.

songs.title: Signs

description.plain: Kodak Black is establishing his place as the hottest new hip hop artist in the game. The 16 year old self proclaimed “Chosen One” of the streets grew up in the Golden Acres projects of Pompano Beach, FL.He began rapping at the age of twelve with the group Brutal Youngnz. His favorite rapper was Lil Boosie. Kodak was inspired not only by Boosie’s style, but also by his success. Kodak thought if Lil Boosie could become successful in his career and make a living rapping, he could do the same. As his experience with music progressed, he became affiliated with the Kolyons, a popular local group from Broward County. As a teenager growing up without a father, Kodak learned very early that he would have to hustle to survive. He started robbing as a way to provide for himself and his family. After several run ins with the law, he was placed in a juvenile detention center a total of three times in one year and finally placed on probation. It was then that he decided to put all his time and energy into his music career with the help of Dollaz N Dealz ENT. The CEO of Dollaz N Dealz, A.D. Julien, saw a star quality in Kodak Black that he had never seen before. Kodak was wise beyond his years and had the ability to light up a room with his presence. He decided to invest in Kodak Black’s solo career and signed him to the DND label. On December 25, 2013 Kodak Black dropped his first mixtape titled, “Project Baby.” The response from the streets was so overwhelming that Kodak and the DND family started gaining nationwide exposure. Gaining this level of success at the age of sixteen has only motivated Kodak Black to grind harder. As he continues to gain exposure, he continues to set more trends and breaks more records.

body.plain: Kodak Black is establishing his place as the hottest new hip hop artist in the game. The 16 year old self proclaimed “Chosen One” of the streets grew up in the Golden Acres projects of Pompano Beach, FL.He began rapping at the age of twelve with the group Brutal Youngnz. His favorite rapper was Lil Boosie. Kodak was inspired not only by Boosie’s style, but also by his success. Kodak thought if Lil Boosie could become successful in his career and make a living rapping, he could do the same. As his experience with music progressed, he became affiliated with the Kolyons, a popular local group from Broward County. As a teenager growing up without a father, Kodak learned very early that he would have to hustle to survive. He started robbing as a way to provide for himself and his family. After several run ins with the law, he was placed in a juvenile detention center a total of three times in one year and finally placed on probation. It was then that he decided to put all his time and energy into his music career with the help of Dollaz N Dealz ENT. The CEO of Dollaz N Dealz, A.D. Julien, saw a star quality in Kodak Black that he had never seen before. Kodak was wise beyond his years and had the ability to light up a room with his presence. He decided to invest in Kodak Black’s solo career and signed him to the DND label. On December 25, 2013 Kodak Black dropped his first mixtape titled, “Project Baby.” The response from the streets was so overwhelming that Kodak and the DND family started gaining nationwide exposure. Gaining this level of success at the age of sixteen has only motivated Kodak Black to grind harder. As he continues to gain exposure, he continues to set more trends and breaks more records.

His favorite rapper was Lil Boosie. Kodak was inspired not only by Boosie’s style, but also by his success. Kodak thought if Lil Boosie could become successful in his career and make a living rapping, he could do the same. As his experience with music progressed, he became affiliated with the Kolyons, a popular local group from Broward County. As a teenager growing up without a father, Kodak learned very early that he would have to hustle to survive. He started robbing as a way to provide for himself and his family. After several run ins with the law, he was placed in a juvenile detention center a total of three times in one year and finally placed on probation. It was then that he decided to put all his time and energy into his music career with the help of Dollaz N Dealz ENT. The CEO of Dollaz N Dealz, A.D. Julien, saw a star quality in Kodak Black that he had never seen before. Kodak was wise beyond his years and had the ability to light up a room with his presence. He decided to invest in Kodak Black’s solo career and signed him to the DND label. On December 25, 2013 Kodak Black dropped his first mixtape titled, “Project Baby.” The response from the streets was so overwhelming that Kodak and the DND family started gaining nationwide exposure. Gaining this level of success at the age of sixteen has only motivated Kodak Black to grind harder. As he continues to gain exposure, he continues to set more trends and breaks more records.
